alert.note: Alert for Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:19PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bath County through 745 PM EDT... At 719 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hot Springs, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Millboro... Warm Springs... Hot Springs... Nimrod Hall... Bacova Junction... and Ingalls Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
